C

S

setClearDisplayOnOperation(boolean) - Method in class com.nmaltais.calcdialog.CalcDialog
Set whether to clear display when an operation button is pressed (+, -, * and /) If not, display will be cleared on next button press Default is not clearing
setFormatChars(char, char) - Method in class com.nmaltais.calcdialog.CalcDialog
Set character for formatting number Use CalcDialog.FORMAT_CHAR_DEFAULT to use device locale's default character By default, formatting will use locale's characters
setGroupingSize(int) - Method in class com.nmaltais.calcdialog.CalcDialog
Set the size of groups separated by group separators 3 does 000,000,000 4 does 0,0000,0000 Default size is 3
setMaxDigits(int, int) - Method in class com.nmaltais.calcdialog.CalcDialog
Set max digits that can be entered on the calculator Use CalcDialog.MAX_DIGITS_UNLIMITED for no limit
setMaxValue(BigDecimal) - Method in class com.nmaltais.calcdialog.CalcDialog
Set maximum value that can be calculated If maximum value is exceeded, an "Out of bounds" error will be shown.
setRoundingMode(int) - Method in class com.nmaltais.calcdialog.CalcDialog
Set calculator's rounding mode Default rounding mode is BigDecimal.ROUND_HALF_UP Ex: 5.5 = 6, 5.49 = 5, -5.5 = -6, 2.5 = 3
setShowZeroWhenNoValue(boolean) - Method in class com.nmaltais.calcdialog.CalcDialog
Set whether zero should be displayed when no value has been entered or just display nothing
setSignCanBeChanged(boolean, int) - Method in class com.nmaltais.calcdialog.CalcDialog
Set whether sign can be changed or not By default, sign can be changed
setStripTrailingZeroes(boolean) - Method in class com.nmaltais.calcdialog.CalcDialog
Set whether to strip zeroes from the result or not By default, zeroes are stripped.
setValue(BigDecimal) - Method in class com.nmaltais.calcdialog.CalcDialog
Set initial value to show By default, initial value is null.
